sudokuGame

Class Population

  • java.lang.Object
    • sudokuGame.Population

  • public class Population
extends java.lang.Object
    This class representing our population, the population is a collection of individuals that every one of them will try to solve the sudoku board. Population class will generate the first generation, and it will be responsible to create the next generation according to selection interface. The next generation base is the current generation but we do crossover with the good individuals and do mutate for some of the individuals. In this class we manage our individuals in an encapsulation class.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Abedalrhman Nsasra
    See Also:
    Individual, Selection, TournamentSelection, Genetic Programming

    • Constructor Detail

      • Population

        public Population(int popSize,
                  Individual prototype,
                  Selection selection)
        Initialize the fields and generate the first generation, the first generation is generated randomly.
        Parameters:
        popSize - is the size of the required population
        prototype - is just a prototype to help as to generate the first generation
        selection - is class that implement Selection interface, and determined the methodology of creation the next generation.

    • Method Detail

      • getBest

        public Individual getBest()
        Return the best player (individual), the best player is the one with the lowest fitness. Since we sorting our players Ascending according to their fitness, the best one (lowest fitness) is the first one.
        Returns:
        the individual with the lowest fitness (the best one).

      • getWorst

        public Individual getWorst()
        Return the worst player (individual), the worst player is the one with the highest fitness. Since we sorting our players ascending according to their fitness, the worst one (highest fitness) is the last one.
        Returns:
        the individual with the highest fitness (the worst one).

      • nextGeneration

        public void nextGeneration()
        Generate the next generation according to Selection methodology. If the current generation failed to solve the sudoku board, then we generate a new generation by mutation and crossover. The property to apply mutation and crossover is determined in Selection, and the methodology to apply the mutation and crossover is determined in reproduce method. There are many different ways to apply mutation and crossover (matting), so we are flexible about it, and who implement the Selection decide how to do it. In the end after creating the new generation we sort the individuals form the best to the worst according to their fitness.

      • sort

        private void sort()
        Just sort the players (individuals) ascending according to there fitness, form the best player (with lower fitness) to the worst (with higher fitness). We use the static method sort from Arrays class.

      • getMutationProb

        public double getMutationProb()
        Returns the probability to apply mutation to any player (individual). The implementation of Selection interface will determine this probability, 0.3 is a good choice.
        Returns:
        the mutation probability (the probability to apply mutation to any player)

      • getCrossoverProb

        public double getCrossoverProb()
        Returns the probability to apply crossover to any player (individual). The implementation of Selection interface will determine this probability, 0.7 is a good choice.
        Returns:
        the crossover probability (the probability to apply crossover to any player, with one of the good individuals)

      • getGoodPopulationPercent

        public double getGoodPopulationPercent()
        Returns what we consider as good population percent, when we create the next generation by matting (crossover), we matting with this percent of the best individuals (with lowest fitness) in the population.
        Returns:
        the the percent of what we consider a good population.

      • getPopulationSize

        public int getPopulationSize()
        Return the size of the population (the amount of the individuals).
        Returns:
        the size of population (the amount of the individuals).

      • countEmptyCellInOriginalSudoku

        public int countEmptyCellInOriginalSudoku()
        Count the empty cells in the original sudoku board, we need this method only for creating a report.
        Returns:
        the amount of the empty cells in the sudoku board.

      • getAvgPopulationFitness

        public double getAvgPopulationFitness()
        Calculate the average of the fitness of the individuals and return it. We need this method only to create a report.
        Returns:
        the average of the individuals's fitness.
